## Code Quality

### Self-Review Checklist
<!-- Ensure you've completed thorough self-review -->
- [ ] Code follows project style guide and conventions
- [ ] Code is DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself)
- [ ] Functions are small and focused (single responsibility)
- [ ] Variable and function names are descriptive
- [ ] Complex logic has explanatory comments
- [ ] No commented-out code blocks
- [ ] No debug console.log statements
- [ ] Error messages are clear and actionable
- [ ] TypeScript types are specific (no `any` unless justified)

### Static Analysis
<!-- All checks must pass before requesting review -->
- [ ] ‚úÖ Linting passes: `pnpm lint`
- [ ] ‚úÖ Formatting passes: `pnpm format:check`
- [ ] ‚úÖ Type checking passes: `pnpm typecheck`
- [ ] ‚úÖ Tests pass: `pnpm test`
- [ ] ‚úÖ Build succeeds: `pnpm build`

**CI Status:**
<!-- GitHub Actions will automatically update this -->

## Checklist
<!-- Final verification before requesting review -->

### Final Code Quality Review

- [ ] I have read and followed the [CONTRIBUTING](CONTRIBUTING.md) guide
- [ ] I have performed a thorough self-review of my code
- [ ] I have reviewed the diff to ensure no unintended changes
- [ ] Code is properly formatted and lint-free
- [ ] No TypeScript errors or warnings

### Final Testing Review

- [ ] All existing tests pass locally
- [ ] New tests cover the changes adequately
- [ ] Manual testing completed successfully
- [ ] Edge cases and error conditions tested

### Final Documentation Review

- [ ] Code comments explain complex logic
- [ ] Public APIs have TSDoc documentation
- [ ] User-facing documentation updated
- [ ] Examples added/updated if needed

### Commits
- [ ] Commit messages follow [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/)
- [ ] Commits are atomic and well-organized
- [ ] Sensitive information excluded from commits

### Review
- [ ] PR title clearly describes the change
- [ ] PR description is complete and accurate
- [ ] Reviewers assigned (@mention below)
- [ ] Labels applied appropriately
